text: well this is the front line outside
Dynamo Kiev football stadium this is the
area which several days ago
protesters battled for and essentially
won they are dug in here just to give
you a sense of the geography Parliament
is over this frontline just a few
hundred meters behind those trees and
it's there that that amnesty bill went
through the political opposition said
they didn't support it and it doesn't go
far enough let's just ask here on the
front lines excuse me this amnesty bill
last night does it go far enough does it
do what you want not at all you don't
accept it go back from jail Chisholm you
want the President to go to prison well
that's their message then and this is
part of their weaponry this is a
catapult which they pull right back and
inside that they'll put some of these
bricks cobblestones which they either
pull back and send over there with
astonishing force those of course to
kill someone for the last few days they
have held off but all they need is an
order and they'll start it all up again
if they feel that they're not getting
anywhere with their demands now under
the amnesty law the protesters have to
leave that frontline but they don't have
to leave this the main Independence
Square though where they've been base
for the last two months they have to get
out of all of the buildings that they've
occupied across Ukraine apart from three
this is one of those buildings we'll
just go in here and you'll get a sense
of how organized what they call this
revolution is very broad church of
society here more middle class people
who are providing supplies to sustain
what's going on here it's not just the
hardliners on the front line if you
wonder through this way with me you get
a sense people have been donating drugs
this is the hospital the pharmacy
where those people on the front line
come to get fixed in essence you really
get a sense in here that despite
everything the president is trying to do
to change the situation they're in it
for the long term
